wikipedia_page.main: James Milo Griffith (11 June 1843 – 8 September 1897) was a Welsh sculptor who, after originally training as an artisan mason, became notable for his memorial statues.

response: * September 8 – James Milo Griffith, Welsh sculptor (born 1843)

The statue, created by the sculptor James Milo Griffith,GRIFFITH , JAMES MILO, Welsh Biography Online. Retrieved 2011-12-29. was finally unveiled on 16 October 1886 and stands in The Hayes, Cardiff. Its plinth is inscribed “JOHN BATCHELOR B.1820 D.1883 THE FRIEND of FREEDOM”.
*Christopher Rice Mansel Talbot buys James Milo Griffith's Summer Flowers for Margam Castle.
